alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:43AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kay, northeastern Kingfisher, Noble, southern Alfalfa, southern Grant, northwestern Logan, northwestern Payne, Garfield and eastern Major Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ponca City to 5 miles northeast of Billings to 4 miles southeast of Enid to near Helena. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Stillwater, Ponca City, Perry, Tonkawa, Hennessey, Crescent, Helena, Waukomis, Garber, Morrison, Lahoma, Glencoe, Covington, Billings, Ringwood, Drummond, Kaw City, Carmen, and Red Rock. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 170 and 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Kingfisher; Logan; Major; Noble; Payne
